summary: The document is a declassified report under the President John F. Kennedy Assassination Records Act of 1992, detailing the activities of Black Panther members in Paris after arriving from Algiers. It describes their reception of lodging and training from a clandestine organization, their attempts to secure plastic surgery and false documentation for clandestine re-entry into the U.S., and an urgent request for photos to identify them before surgery.
key_findings: Identifies Black Panther members: George Edward Wright, George Brown, Elvin McNair, Jean Carol Moon, and Joyce Tillerson.
Reveals the role of a clandestine organization in France supporting the group.
Details the group's plans for plastic surgery and obtaining false documentation for U.S. re-entry.
Emphasizes the urgency of providing photos to identify the individuals pre-surgery.
Mentions that the information has not been shared with the legal attach√©.
keywords: President John F. Kennedy Assassination Records Act of 1992
